page.title: 06HOUSING IN CONGLETON
page.content: The variety of housing in Congleton reflects the 450 years of housing development. A large percentage of housing in Congleton was built in the last 50 years,and over half was built in the last 25 years,these being the private and cou estates.There are a handful of large victorian houses which date back more than 150 years. There are also some postwar houses which are about 40-50 years old,they are recognised by the appearance of their front doors, windows and hipped roofs. Residential housing estates play a big part in catering for the population who use Congleton as a dormitory town. These estates are situated in the suburbs of the town and have been extended frequently,the main building material being brick and a few in stone.
